DOC.brief_title: Differential Effects Eicosapentaenoic Acid ( EPA ) Docosahexaenoic Acid ( DHA ) Platelet , Endothelial Vascular Function
DOC.detailed_description: Relatively study make head-to-head comparison DHA ( 22:6n-3 ) EPA ( 20:5n-3 ) . The understanding differential effect may great interest population low EPA intake vegetarian , may choose supplement dietary intake long-chain n-3 PUFA form DHA-rich algal oil . This study aim investigate effect supplementation oil rich either EPA DHA ( 3g/day , 6 week ) healthy young male platelet , endothelial vascular function , well CVD risk factor . The primary outcome platelet monocyte aggregate endothelial progenitor cell - novel marker platelet endothelial function , measure flow cytometry , Secondary outcomes include capillary density , measure capillaroscopy ass change microvascular function , pulse wave analysis , digital volume pulse ambulatory blood pressure . Other secondary outcome include lipid profile ( TAG , cholesterol , NEFA ) , glycaemic control ( HOMA , QUICKI ) oxidative stress ( isoprostane ) . The omega-3 index ( erythrocyte EPA+DHA ) use marker compliance .
DOC.criteria: Healthy males No smoker Aged 1845y old Able understand information sheet comply trial procedure Having give write consent take part study prior participation . Reported history CVD ( myocardial infarction , angina , venous thrombosis , stroke , dyslipidemia ) , diabetes ( fast glucose â‰¥ 6.1 mmol/L ) , cancer , kidney , liver bowel disease . Presence gastrointestinal disorder use drug , likely alter gastrointestinal motility nutrient absorption . Current smoker ; history substance abuse alcoholism ( previous weekly alcohol intake > 60 units/week ) ; current selfreported weekly alcohol intake exceed 28 unit Recent use hypolipidaemic , antihypertensive , antiplatelet antithrombotic mediation Platelet count normal range history indicative congenital acquire platelet haemostatic defect . Allergy intolerance component study capsule Unwilling restrict consumption source fish oil length study Subjects reporting consumption > 1 portion oily fish per week Weight change > 3 kg precede 2 month ; BMI < 18 > 32 kg/m2 Blood pressure > 160/90 mmHg Fasting blood cholesterol > 6.5 mmol/L ; fast triacylglycerol concentration > 2.0 mmol/L
